summary: Build a simple browser-based shooting game (likely with React visuals; optional backend for scoring/progress).
architectural_notes: Target a browser-based shooter; use React for visuals; optionally add a backend for scoring/progress saving.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Top-down player spaceship sprite, neon arcade style, transparent background (player-ship.dim_256x256.png)
- Enemy drone sprite, neon arcade style, transparent background (enemy-drone.dim_256x256.png)
- Bullet/laser projectile sprite, neon arcade style, transparent background (laser-bullet.dim_64x64.png)
- Seamless starfield background, dark with subtle neon accents (starfield-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Implement a playable 2D browser shooting game in the React frontend with a complete game loop (start, play, pause, game over, restart). The game must include: player movement controls, shooting mechanics, enemy spawning and movement, bullet/enemy collision detection, player damage or lives, scoring, and increasing difficulty over time.

Create a game UI layer (HUD) that displays at least: current score, lives/health, and current difficulty level or wave indicator. Include clear on-screen instructions for controls (keyboard/mouse) on the start screen and/or pause overlay.

Add a persistent leaderboard backed by the Motoko canister: allow signed-in users (Internet Identity) to submit their final score at game over, store per-user best score, and provide a public Top 10 leaderboard query.

Establish a coherent visual theme for the game UI (colors, typography, layout) and apply it consistently across the start screen, HUD, pause overlay, game over screen, and leaderboard. Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

Add required generated static image assets (player, enemy, bullet, background) to the frontend and render them in-game (either via Canvas drawing or positioned DOM elements), without serving images through the backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Backend (single Motoko actor) must expose stable, minimal APIs for leaderboard functionality: submitScore(score : Nat) and getTopScores(limit : Nat) returning a sorted list with principals and scores. Use stable storage so scores persist across upgrades.

projectName: Browser-based shooting game with optional persistent leaderboard
